item.title: The Java's Boolean class
item.description: As of Java 9 the Boolean class constructors have become deprecated and when we want to use Boolean instances we use Boolean.TRUE or Boolean.FALSE constants. We can get one of these constants from a primitive using the Boolean.valueOf() method. System.out.println(Boolean.valueOf(true) == Boolean.TRUE); // true System.out.println(Boolean.valueOf(false) == Boolean.FALSE); // true This method also accepts a String that, if it equals the word true, ignoring if the letters are uppercase or lowercase, the result will be equal to Boolean.
